subject: Re: [junit] Can anyone help me see how to usefully work with JUnit in a big project, please?
msgSnippet: ... True, but it s called TDD, and not TGD, right?  :-) I can go with Test-Driven Development , but Test-Driven Design sounds very dangerous to me. --
messageBody:
On 10/29/06, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...> wrote:
>
> > But drive my design with tests? That's dangerous and can potentially
> lead to
> > micro-design, i.e. design without seeing the big picture ("I'll use this
> > signature because the test looks cleaner then").
>
> I notice that Joakim wrote "guide" and Cedric read "drive". As far as I
> know, those words have nonoverlapping meanings.


True, but it's called TDD, and not TGD, right? :-)

I can go with "Test-Driven Development", but "Test-Driven Design" sounds
very dangerous to me.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
